005package edu.wpi.first.math.estimator;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.MathSharedStore;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Twist2d;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.interpolation.TimeInterpolatableBuffer;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.Kinematics;
018import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.Odometry;
019import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
020import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3;
021import java.util.NavigableMap;
022import java.util.Optional;
023import java.util.TreeMap;
024
025/**
026 * This class wraps {@link Odometry} to fuse latency-compensated vision measurements with encoder
027 * measurements. Robot code should not use this directly- Instead, use the particular type for your
028 * drivetrain (e.g., {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator}). It is intended to be a drop-in
029 * replacement for {@link Odometry}; in fact, if you never call {@link
030 * PoseEstimator#addVisionMeasurement} and only call {@link PoseEstimator#update} then this will
031 * behave exactly the same as Odometry.
032 *
033 * <p>{@link PoseEstimator#update} should be called every robot loop.
034 *
035 * <p>{@link PoseEstimator#addVisionMeasurement} can be called as infrequently as you want; if you
036 * never call it then this class will behave exactly like regular encoder odometry.
037 *
038 * @param <T> Wheel positions type.
039 */
040public class PoseEstimator<T> {
041  private final Odometry<T> m_odometry;
042  private final Matrix<N3, N1> m_q = new Matrix<>(Nat.N3(), Nat.N1());
043  private final Matrix<N3, N3> m_visionK = new Matrix<>(Nat.N3(), Nat.N3());
044
045  private static final double kBufferDuration = 1.5;
046  // Maps timestamps to odometry-only pose estimates
047  private final TimeInterpolatableBuffer<Pose2d> m_odometryPoseBuffer =
048      TimeInterpolatableBuffer.createBuffer(kBufferDuration);
049  // Maps timestamps to vision updates
050  // Always contains one entry before the oldest entry in m_odometryPoseBuffer, unless there have
051  // been no vision measurements after the last reset
052  private final NavigableMap<Double, VisionUpdate> m_visionUpdates = new TreeMap<>();
053
054  private Pose2d m_poseEstimate;
055
056  /**
057   * Constructs a PoseEstimator.
058   *
059   * @param kinematics A correctly-configured kinematics object for your drivetrain.
060   * @param odometry A correctly-configured odometry object for your drivetrain.
061   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of the pose estimate (x position in meters, y position
062   *     in meters, and heading in radians). Increase these numbers to trust your state estimate
063   *     less.
064   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision pose measurement (x position
065   *     in meters, y position in meters, and heading in radians). Increase these numbers to trust
066   *     the vision pose measurement less.
067   */
068  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UnusedFormalParameter")
069  public PoseEstimator(
070      Kinematics<?, T> kinematics,
071      Odometry<T> odometry,
072      Matrix<N3, N1> stateStdDevs,
073      Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs) {
074    m_odometry = odometry;
075
076    m_poseEstimate = m_odometry.getPoseMeters();
077
078    for (int i = 0; i < 3; ++i) {
079      m_q.set(i, 0, stateStdDevs.get(i, 0) * stateStdDevs.get(i, 0));
080    }
081    setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(visionMeasurementStdDevs);
082  }
083
084  /**
085   * Sets the pose estimator's trust of global measurements. This might be used to change trust in
086   * vision measurements after the autonomous period, or to change trust as distance to a vision
087   * target increases.
088   *
089   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision measurements. Increase these
090   *     numbers to trust global measurements from vision less. This matrix is in the form [x, y,
091   *     theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
092   */
093  public final void setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs) {
094    var r = new double[3];
095    for (int i = 0; i < 3; ++i) {
096      r[i] = visionMeasurementStdDevs.get(i, 0) * visionMeasurementStdDevs.get(i, 0);
097    }
098
099    // Solve for closed form Kalman gain for continuous Kalman filter with A = 0
100    // and C = I. See wpimath/algorithms.md.
101    for (int row = 0; row < 3; ++row) {
102      if (m_q.get(row, 0) == 0.0) {
103        m_visionK.set(row, row, 0.0);
104      } else {
105        m_visionK.set(
106            row, row, m_q.get(row, 0) / (m_q.get(row, 0) + Math.sqrt(m_q.get(row, 0) * r[row])));
107      }
108    }
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Resets the robot's position on the field.
113   *
114   * <p>The gyroscope angle does not need to be reset here on the user's robot code. The library
115   * automatically takes care of offsetting the gyro angle.
116   *
117   * @param gyroAngle The angle reported by the gyroscope.
118   * @param wheelPositions The current encoder readings.
119   * @param poseMeters The position on the field that your robot is at.
120   */
121  public void resetPosition(Rotation2d gyroAngle, T wheelPositions, Pose2d poseMeters) {
122    // Reset state estimate and error covariance
123    m_odometry.resetPosition(gyroAngle, wheelPositions, poseMeters);
124    m_odometryPoseBuffer.clear();
125    m_visionUpdates.clear();
126    m_poseEstimate = m_odometry.getPoseMeters();
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Resets the robot's pose.
131   *
132   * @param pose The pose to reset to.
133   */
134  public void resetPose(Pose2d pose) {
135    m_odometry.resetPose(pose);
136    m_odometryPoseBuffer.clear();
137  }
138
139  /**
140   * Resets the robot's translation.
141   *
142   * @param translation The pose to translation to.
143   */
144  public void resetTranslation(Translation2d translation) {
145    m_odometry.resetTranslation(translation);
146    m_odometryPoseBuffer.clear();
147  }
148
149  /**
150   * Resets the robot's rotation.
151   *
152   * @param rotation The rotation to reset to.
153   */
154  public void resetRotation(Rotation2d rotation) {
155    m_odometry.resetRotation(rotation);
156    m_odometryPoseBuffer.clear();
157  }
158
159  /**
160   * Gets the estimated robot pose.
161   *
162   * @return The estimated robot pose in meters.
163   */
164  public Pose2d getEstimatedPosition() {
165    return m_poseEstimate;
166  }
167
168  /**
169   * Return the pose at a given timestamp, if the buffer is not empty.
170   *
171   * @param timestampSeconds The pose's timestamp in seconds.
172   * @return The pose at the given timestamp (or Optional.empty() if the buffer is empty).
173   */
174  public Optional<Pose2d> sampleAt(double timestampSeconds) {
175    // Step 0: If there are no odometry updates to sample, skip.
176    if (m_odometryPoseBuffer.getInternalBuffer().isEmpty()) {
177      return Optional.empty();
178    }
179
180    // Step 1: Make sure timestamp matches the sample from the odometry pose buffer. (When sampling,
181    // the buffer will always use a timestamp between the first and last timestamps)
182    double oldestOdometryTimestamp = m_odometryPoseBuffer.getInternalBuffer().firstKey();
183    double newestOdometryTimestamp = m_odometryPoseBuffer.getInternalBuffer().lastKey();
184    timestampSeconds =
185        MathUtil.clamp(timestampSeconds, oldestOdometryTimestamp, newestOdometryTimestamp);
186
187    // Step 2: If there are no applicable vision updates, use the odometry-only information.
188    if (m_visionUpdates.isEmpty() || timestampSeconds < m_visionUpdates.firstKey()) {
189      return m_odometryPoseBuffer.getSample(timestampSeconds);
190    }
191
192    // Step 3: Get the latest vision update from before or at the timestamp to sample at.
193    double floorTimestamp = m_visionUpdates.floorKey(timestampSeconds);
194    var visionUpdate = m_visionUpdates.get(floorTimestamp);
195
196    // Step 4: Get the pose measured by odometry at the time of the sample.
197    var odometryEstimate = m_odometryPoseBuffer.getSample(timestampSeconds);
198
199    // Step 5: Apply the vision compensation to the odometry pose.
200    return odometryEstimate.map(odometryPose -> visionUpdate.compensate(odometryPose));
201  }
202
203  /** Removes stale vision updates that won't affect sampling. */
204  private void cleanUpVisionUpdates() {
205    // Step 0: If there are no odometry samples, skip.
206    if (m_odometryPoseBuffer.getInternalBuffer().isEmpty()) {
207      return;
208    }
209
210    // Step 1: Find the oldest timestamp that needs a vision update.
211    double oldestOdometryTimestamp = m_odometryPoseBuffer.getInternalBuffer().firstKey();
212
213    // Step 2: If there are no vision updates before that timestamp, skip.
214    if (m_visionUpdates.isEmpty() || oldestOdometryTimestamp < m_visionUpdates.firstKey()) {
215      return;
216    }
217
218    // Step 3: Find the newest vision update timestamp before or at the oldest timestamp.
219    double newestNeededVisionUpdateTimestamp = m_visionUpdates.floorKey(oldestOdometryTimestamp);
220
221    // Step 4: Remove all entries strictly before the newest timestamp we need.
222    m_visionUpdates.headMap(newestNeededVisionUpdateTimestamp, false).clear();
223  }
224
225  /**
226   * Adds a vision measurement to the Kalman Filter. This will correct the odometry pose estimate
227   * while still accounting for measurement noise.
228   *
229   * <p>This method can be called as infrequently as you want, as long as you are calling {@link
230   * PoseEstimator#update} every loop.
231   *
232   * <p>To promote stability of the pose estimate and make it robust to bad vision data, we
233   * recommend only adding vision measurements that are already within one meter or so of the
234   * current pose estimate.
235   *
236   * @param visionRobotPoseMeters The pose of the robot as measured by the vision camera.
237   * @param timestampSeconds The timestamp of the vision measurement in seconds. Note that if you
238   *     don't use your own time source by calling {@link
239   *     PoseEstimator#updateWithTime(double,Rotation2d,Object)} then you must use a timestamp with
240   *     an epoch since FPGA startup (i.e., the epoch of this timestamp is the same epoch as {@link
241   *     edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer#getFPGATimestamp()}.) This means that you should use {@link
242   *     edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer#getFPGATimestamp()} as your time source or sync the epochs.
243   */
244  public void addVisionMeasurement(Pose2d visionRobotPoseMeters, double timestampSeconds) {
245    // Step 0: If this measurement is old enough to be outside the pose buffer's timespan, skip.
246    if (m_odometryPoseBuffer.getInternalBuffer().isEmpty()
247        || m_odometryPoseBuffer.getInternalBuffer().lastKey() - kBufferDuration
248            > timestampSeconds) {
249      return;
250    }
251
252    // Step 1: Clean up any old entries
253    cleanUpVisionUpdates();
254
255    // Step 2: Get the pose measured by odometry at the moment the vision measurement was made.
256    var odometrySample = m_odometryPoseBuffer.getSample(timestampSeconds);
257
258    if (odometrySample.isEmpty()) {
259      return;
260    }
261
262    // Step 3: Get the vision-compensated pose estimate at the moment the vision measurement was
263    // made.
264    var visionSample = sampleAt(timestampSeconds);
265
266    if (visionSample.isEmpty()) {
267      return;
268    }
269
270    // Step 4: Measure the twist between the old pose estimate and the vision pose.
271    var twist = visionSample.get().log(visionRobotPoseMeters);
272
273    // Step 5: We should not trust the twist entirely, so instead we scale this twist by a Kalman
274    // gain matrix representing how much we trust vision measurements compared to our current pose.
275    var k_times_twist = m_visionK.times(VecBuilder.fill(twist.dx, twist.dy, twist.dtheta));
276
277    // Step 6: Convert back to Twist2d.
278    var scaledTwist =
279        new Twist2d(k_times_twist.get(0, 0), k_times_twist.get(1, 0), k_times_twist.get(2, 0));
280
281    // Step 7: Calculate and record the vision update.
282    var visionUpdate = new VisionUpdate(visionSample.get().exp(scaledTwist), odometrySample.get());
283    m_visionUpdates.put(timestampSeconds, visionUpdate);
284
285    // Step 8: Remove later vision measurements. (Matches previous behavior)
286    m_visionUpdates.tailMap(timestampSeconds, false).entrySet().clear();
287
288    // Step 9: Update latest pose estimate. Since we cleared all updates after this vision update,
289    // it's guaranteed to be the latest vision update.
290    m_poseEstimate = visionUpdate.compensate(m_odometry.getPoseMeters());
291  }
292
293  /**
294   * Adds a vision measurement to the Kalman Filter. This will correct the odometry pose estimate
295   * while still accounting for measurement noise.
296   *
297   * <p>This method can be called as infrequently as you want, as long as you are calling {@link
298   * PoseEstimator#update} every loop.
299   *
300   * <p>To promote stability of the pose estimate and make it robust to bad vision data, we
301   * recommend only adding vision measurements that are already within one meter or so of the
302   * current pose estimate.
303   *
304   * <p>Note that the vision measurement standard deviations passed into this method will continue
305   * to apply to future measurements until a subsequent call to {@link
306   * PoseEstimator#setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(Matrix)} or this method.
307   *
308   * @param visionRobotPoseMeters The pose of the robot as measured by the vision camera.
309   * @param timestampSeconds The timestamp of the vision measurement in seconds. Note that if you
310   *     don't use your own time source by calling {@link #updateWithTime}, then you must use a
311   *     timestamp with an epoch since FPGA startup (i.e., the epoch of this timestamp is the same
312   *     epoch as {@link edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer#getFPGATimestamp()}). This means that you
313   *     should use {@link edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer#getFPGATimestamp()} as your time source in
314   *     this case.
315   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision pose measurement (x position
316   *     in meters, y position in meters, and heading in radians). Increase these numbers to trust
317   *     the vision pose measurement less.
318   */
319  public void addVisionMeasurement(
320      Pose2d visionRobotPoseMeters,
321      double timestampSeconds,
322      Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs) {
323    setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(visionMeasurementStdDevs);
324    addVisionMeasurement(visionRobotPoseMeters, timestampSeconds);
325  }
326
327  /**
328   * Updates the pose estimator with wheel encoder and gyro information. This should be called every
329   * loop.
330   *
331   * @param gyroAngle The current gyro angle.
332   * @param wheelPositions The current encoder readings.
333   * @return The estimated pose of the robot in meters.
334   */
335  public Pose2d update(Rotation2d gyroAngle, T wheelPositions) {
336    return updateWithTime(MathSharedStore.getTimestamp(), gyroAngle, wheelPositions);
337  }
338
339  /**
340   * Updates the pose estimator with wheel encoder and gyro information. This should be called every
341   * loop.
342   *
343   * @param currentTimeSeconds Time at which this method was called, in seconds.
344   * @param gyroAngle The current gyro angle.
345   * @param wheelPositions The current encoder readings.
346   * @return The estimated pose of the robot in meters.
347   */
348  public Pose2d updateWithTime(double currentTimeSeconds, Rotation2d gyroAngle, T wheelPositions) {
349    var odometryEstimate = m_odometry.update(gyroAngle, wheelPositions);
350
351    m_odometryPoseBuffer.addSample(currentTimeSeconds, odometryEstimate);
352
353    if (m_visionUpdates.isEmpty()) {
354      m_poseEstimate = odometryEstimate;
355    } else {
356      var visionUpdate = m_visionUpdates.get(m_visionUpdates.lastKey());
357      m_poseEstimate = visionUpdate.compensate(odometryEstimate);
358    }
359
360    return getEstimatedPosition();
361  }
362
363  /**
364   * Represents a vision update record. The record contains the vision-compensated pose estimate as
365   * well as the corresponding odometry pose estimate.
366   */
367  private static final class VisionUpdate {
368    // The vision-compensated pose estimate.
369    private final Pose2d visionPose;
370
371    // The pose estimated based solely on odometry.
372    private final Pose2d odometryPose;
373
374    /**
375     * Constructs a vision update record with the specified parameters.
376     *
377     * @param visionPose The vision-compensated pose estimate.
378     * @param odometryPose The pose estimate based solely on odometry.
379     */
380    private VisionUpdate(Pose2d visionPose, Pose2d odometryPose) {
381      this.visionPose = visionPose;
382      this.odometryPose = odometryPose;
383    }
384
385    /**
386     * Returns the vision-compensated version of the pose. Specifically, changes the pose from being
387     * relative to this record's odometry pose to being relative to this record's vision pose.
388     *
389     * @param pose The pose to compensate.
390     * @return The compensated pose.
391     */
392    public Pose2d compensate(Pose2d pose) {
393      var delta = pose.minus(this.odometryPose);
394      return this.visionPose.plus(delta);
395    }
396  }
397}
